page.title: 16NEW ROADS Melton Ross Elsham
page.content: The Humber Bridge acted as a catalyst to the development of this area. The motorway network reached to Barnetby Top in 1977,this was linked to Barton by the dual carriageway, A15 in 1978. The Bridge opened in June 1981, that summer saw the commencement of const ruction of the Â£ 16 million 7.75 mile link road to Immingham. The construc- tion work, using a new cement process went well, and was opened 9 mts early in march 1983. Later that same year, the dual carriageway of the A180 (T) was completed to Grimsby. The opening of the A180,linking the HumberBank Ind ustries and Grimsby with the motorway network has had an immense effect; the heavy traffic and frequent accidents on the old A18 became a thing of the past.The excellent roads have been a major selling point of the Elsham Wold Industrial Estate.
